title: Happy Leif Erikson Day!
sub_head: America has more than 2,000 such commemorations, from National Noodle Day to National Iguana Appreciation Day.
body:
‘It’s National Noodle Day,” said the Wednesday email from P.F. Chang’s. Thanks to the geniuses on Madison Avenue, every day is an occasion. “Celebrate today with your favorite noodle dish,” I was advised. According to NationalToday.com, which tracks such things, Oct. 6 was also World Cerebral Palsy Day, National Walk and Bike to School Day, National Plus Size Appreciation Day and—I’m not kidding—National Transfer Money to Your Daughter Day.
Widely recognized holidays sometimes have obscure tie-ins. Monday is Columbus Day, but it’s also National Sausage Pizza Day. Halloween doubles as Visit a Cemetery Day and National Knock Knock Joke Day.
